content.rendered:
The following Step UP! resources are available for students and other non-facilitators:

General Information

Step UP! Program Worksheets and Handouts

The following worksheets and handouts are available in PDF format. The initial training presentations are available in PPT format.

Worksheets

  • 5 Core Questions (Scenario Worksheet) (Appendix B)
  • 5 Point Formula Script (Appendix B)
  • Value-Based Decisions (Appendix B)
  • Where will I go from here?

Handouts

Step UP! General Program Information

  • BEFORE YOU BEGIN – Read This
  • 5 Decision Making Steps (Appendix E)
  • E.E. Model (Appendix G)
  • The Kitty Genovese Story (Appendix H)
  • The Milgram Experiment (Appendix I)
  • Definitions (Appendix D)
  • The Dovidio (et. al.) Summary of Situational Factors and Psychological Processes that Determine Whether a Person will be Helped (Appendix F)

Strategies for Effective Helping

  • Emergency/Non Emergency Helping
  • 5 Point Formula and Sample Script (Appendix B)
  • Intervention Styles
  • Value-Based Decisions (Appendix B)
  • Within Your Team, When Dealing with High Emotion, and How to Increase Helping

Videos

  • View all video resources.

Intervention Stories

View the following videos for Step UP! program and related bystander intervention stories. Video links may take you out of the Step UP! website and to other sites where there are links and comments not affiliated with Step UP!

  • Awareness Test
    YouTube
  • Bystander Effect — People Watch Girl Being Abducted
    NBC Today
  • 1 is 2 Many – PSA on Domestic Violence
    YouTube
  • Bystander Effect – No one helps as 15 year old is gang raped in California
    CNN
  • Bystanders Lift Burning Car
    YouTube
  • “Snack Man” – A great example of creative intervention!
    YouTube
  • Video of a man being beaten and robbed with others watching
    YouTube
  • Obedience to Authority – Security Guards watch beating b/c they are told to only “observe and report”
    USA Today
  • The Smoke-Filled Room Study (Bystander Diffusion of Responsibility)
    YouTube
  • Stanford Prisoner Experiment: How Roles Can Affect Our Attitudes and Behaviors
    Stanford University / YouTube
  • What Would You Do?
    ABC News Feature with John Quiñones
  • Who Are You?
    Put yourself at this party – what actions would you take – and when?
